results.title: The Doll's house. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Paramount Communications, Hillard Elkins and Patrick Garland
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film based on Ibsen’s feminist play of the same name. Set in the 1890’s, it concerns a woman’s attempt to find a role in society for herself apart from those of wife and mother. Stars Claire Bloom, Anthony Hopkins, Denholm Elliott, Anna Massey.

results.title: The Dole Generation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Two items from the Four Corners television program. “The Dole Generation” looks at the frustration’s of the unemployed and some community work-schemes operating in Adelaide for young people. ‘Russian Nuclear accident’ traces the clues that makes Dr Zhores Meduedev, an exiled Soviet biochemist, believe that stored nuclear waste accidentally exploded in the Ural mountains of Russia in 1957, killing several thousand people

results.title: The Dogs of war
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Larry Dewaay and John irvin
results.brief_description: This rivetting adaptation of Frederick Forsyth’s best-selling novel of the same name stars Christopher Walken and Tom Berenger as mercenary soldiers involved in the overthrow of a corrupt black African dictatorship. An intricate game ensues where double cross is the rule and the strike force they have organised find themselves caught between the shadowy international cartel who hired them and the dictator they are sworn to depose. The story focuses with chilling accuracy on the perilous lives of mercenaries, soldiers for hire, and the dirty battles they fight, often impervious to the morality of the assignment and its political integrity.

results.title: The Dogfish as a vertebrate
results.brief_description: Deals with the Dogfish as a typical vertebrate, illustrating its anatomy in detail. Comparisons with four other types are given; i.e., with newt, lizard, bird and rabbit. Fishes, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals included in vertebrates; basic plan demonstrated by Dogfish. Alimentary canal has mouth, oesophagus, stomach, intestinal colonic regions; liver and pancreas; also central nervous system, sense organs. Detail from Dogfish; comparisons in the other four types (frog, lizard, bird and rabbit). Skeleton - axial and appendicular - common to all. Respiratory system involves large surfaces for oxygenation of blood - gills, lungs. Ventral position of heart; plans of blood systems. Gills as embryonic vestiges. Urinogenital systems association. Sexual reproduction and separate sexes common to vertebrates; detail for Dogfish (internal fertilization), Frog (external fertilization).

results.creator_credit: Production Film Services and South Africa. Union Education Dept.
results.brief_description: A film made to encourage love and care of animals by children. Shows the main characteristics and features of the dog. Various types of dogs and their usefulness to humans are shown.

results.title: The Doctor
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Laura Ziskin and Randa Haines
results.brief_description: William Hurt stars as a doctor who faces his mortality and his own, previously callous, handling of patients, when he himself becomes seriously ill. As well as being a personal drama about one man’s journey into self discovery and self awareness, the narrative also, in part, addressees the inequities of the American medical system whereby the medical care of the poor is seriously compromised. Also stars Alan Arkin and Elizabeth Perkins.

results.title: The Doctor
results.brief_description: Members of the medical profession may specialise in one or perhaps more of the hundreds of branches of medical science, according to their own choice and ability. This doctor is a children’s specialist - a pediatrician - and the film is designed to show both parents and children what a typical day’s work is like for him, in a big hospital, and at his private consulting rooms.

results.title: The DNA story
results.creator_credit: VSM Productions, Ronald Fouracre and Peter Shaw
results.brief_description: James Watson and Francis Crick at Cambridge, Maurice Wilkins at King’s College, London and Linus Pauling at Caltech describe the events and research leading to the discovery in 1953 of the double helix as a workable structure for DNA. Concentrates upon the role of chemistry and physics in finding the structure of DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid). Gives some background to the rise of molecular biology and the foundation of crystallography and model building.

results.title: The DNA connection
results.creator_credit: BBC, WGBH (Boston), James F. Golway and Cynthia Page
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Cracking the code”.
The Human Genome Project shows just how close we are to microbes, pigs and worms, which may be a fascinating and unsettling discovery.

results.title: The Divorce of lady X
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Alexander Korda and Tim Wheelan
results.brief_description: This is a delightful and light romantic comedy starring Laurence Olivier and Merle Oberon. A thick fog in London forces those at a fancy dress ball to remain overnight at the hotel where the ball is being held. As there is a room shortage the charming and lovely Leslie Steel (Oberon) is forced to share a room with the irritable and handsome lawyer Evarard Logan (Olivier). The lawyer assumes that the mysterious and yet unnamed character is married. The following day an accusing Lord Mee (Ralph Richardson) talks of his wife spending the night in a man’s room. Smitten and bewildered Everard Logan is forced to think of the consequences believing that he might know the clients of a divorce case that he is working on better than he thought! This easy going yet sophisticated comedy is well performed and enjoyable.
